page.title: 06BULL POINT LIGHTHOUSE
page.content: Bull Point Lighthouse, just north of Morte Point, was originally built in 1879, to the dismay of the many people of Mortehoe who relied on the frequent wrecks along this inhospitable coastline for extra income. In 1972, however, there was a landslide below the lighthouse, and cracks appeared in the building. A portable light from Crowe was used until the new lighthouse was completed in 1975, built higher up the cliffs, and incorporating many automatic devices. It was built by local builders T.R.Yeo & Sons, and was opened on 25th July 1975 by Captain Tibbett, who arrived by helicopter. The light is manned by a husband and wife team, currently Mr & Mrs Tom Whiston. The light flashes three times every ten seconds. The fog horn blasts every minute in poor visibility
